editorialNotes.standard: It’s one thing to say you’d never take a bribe: It’s quite another when your options are taking one or missing rent or going hungry. That’s but a taste of the moral quandaries in Papers, Please, which puts you in the shoes of a border checkpoint agent in a fictional 1980s nation. Learning to master passport processing skills, avoiding fines, and making the most of your paycheck is uniquely satisfying and provocative in a way few games manage to achieve. This celebrated indie gem teaches us as much about empathy as it does time management.
Control a massive arcade claw machine to grab knives, swords, and other handy items as you delve deep into this clever roguelike RPG.

Reimagining the decades-old blockbuster of the same name, Castle of Illusion Starring Mickey Mouse revamps Disney's love letter to classic platformers with a fantastic new design. Whether you have fond memories of the original or this is your first romp through the manic lands of the evil witch Mizrabel, Castle of Illusion epitomizes fantastic platforming. It’s an outstanding return for Disney’s most beloved mascot.
This turn-based RPG recalls the secret-filled dungeons of old-school classics—and adds contemporary tweaks like awesome lighting effects and a streamlined interface.
We loved returning to this bizarre world to fight, craft, and chuckle—and the sequel goes big with new features like handcrafted environments and dodge-rolls.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: This is not relaxing. This is not simple. But it is so, so good.
editorialNotes.tagline: Beware: this game has no mercy

editorialNotes.standard: Dead Cells is a celebration of perseverence: In this game, death is never final, but an essential learning tool. With every new run through ever-changing, enemy-infested levels, you get a little stronger and a little more skilled at overcoming relentless adversaries—and gradually overcome obstacles that once felt insurmountable. The acclaimed roguelike platformer makes all rewards feel earned; you'll be motivated to to brush off mistakes and charge back into battle again and again.
Follow the story of the acclaimed anime—or hop straight into battle as your favorite heroes—in the action-packed mobile version of the 2008 fighting game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Investigate a gorgeous alien world while dominating turn-based battles with precisely timed combos in this superbly written RPG.

Explore imposing dungeons, battle savage monsters, and travel the high seas in this luscious top-down fantasy adventure from Cornfox & Bros. Featuring gorgeous art direction reminiscent of The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker, music by legendary videogame composers Nobuo Uematsu and Kenji Ito, and a wonderful world filled with secrets, Oceanhorn is an incredible journey.
editorialNotes.short: Explore uncharted seas in this beautiful, action-packed gem.

editorialNotes.standard: Not only is Knights of the Old Republic one of the best Star Wars games, but it's also regarded as one of the best role-playing games ever made. This version of BioWare's remarkable achievement features an interface adjusted for touch input. It lets you wield the Force and slash lightsabers across multiple worlds as you team up with brilliantly realized characters and follow an intriguing plot shaped by the choices you make.

editorialNotes.standard: This impressive mash-up does so many things right, it’s hard to know where to start. How about the story, a tense sci-fi drama told in rapid-fire dialogue? Love that! And then the action starts, flooring us by how smoothly the puzzle-style path-finding snaps together with the turn-based battles. The longer the path you draw, the harder you hit? Love that even more!
Prove your penitence by parrying snakes with oversize fangs in this bleak but beautiful platformer.

editorialNotes.standard: Tear apart the world to rebuild it in this creative post-apocalyptic survival game with an upgrade system that compels us to explore and experiment.

editorialNotes.standard: Tend to crops—and find love—while revitalizing your hometown in this cozy made-for-mobile spin on the beloved farming simulator.

editorialNotes.short: Explore the history of role-playing games on this delightfully creative journey.

editorialNotes.standard: From the makers of indie masterpiece Bastion, this stunning RPG thrusts you into a hauntingly beautiful sci-fi world brimming with intrigue. To unravel the mysteries of Cloudbank, you’ll need to fight robotic goons in intense tactical battles while modifying your weapon with powerful new abilities. Transistor’s gorgeous artwork, affecting soundtrack, and riveting story all blend to create a truly one-of-a-kind experience.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Mika Mobile has crafted a superb and wonderfully robust role-playing game in Battleheart Legacy. Each hero can equip a diverse assortment of abilities, ranging from devastating spells to adept swordsmanship and stealthy rogue attacks. The game’s flexible combat system allows you to freely mix skills and spells as you slay hordes of goblins, bats, and skeletons. Battleheart Legacy is a polished, beautifully animated game with a wealth of places to explore and plenty of ways to play.

With society in ruins and mechanized armies locked in war, a lone robot fights to help his human friend. Battle troops, drones, and giant bosses in thrilling third-person combat, using cover and fierce attacks to survive overwhelming odds. Fluid controls, gorgeous visuals, and an engaging backstory will keep you hooked as you uncover the secrets of Epoch 2’s devastated world.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Try to avoid getting the boot from a posh 1920s boarding school in this riveting choice-based caper from the makers of the Apple Design Award–winning Overboard!

editorialNotes.standard: One of the most influential RPGs of all time, Final Fantasy VII takes you on an unforgettable journey through a harsh and unforgiving sci-fi landscape. Packed with tense turn-based combat and an extraordinary story, Square Enix’s masterpiece is as exhilarating now as it was when it was first released in 1997.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Originally released in 2000, Final Fantasy IX set a new standard for the series—and it’s still astoundingly impressive. It’s a perfect blend of beloved RPG elements from previous entries and modernized battle encounters. As you make your way through the story’s twists and turns, you’ll encounter unforgettable characters, frighteningly powerful enemies, and a wonderful fantasy world to explore.

editorialNotes.standard: Striking artwork, dark humor, and great dialogue liven up this point-and-click adventure about uncovering the cause of a deadly outbreak.
Angling for an unconventional RPG? Try casting a line to catch foes in a playful, puzzle-filled realm.
